qas.question: Who warned of impending Israeli attack on Syria in May 1967?
Who found the claims of Israeli attack baseless?
How many steps did Nasser take in preparation for war?
On what day did Nasser state "The battle will be a general one and our basic objective will be to destroy Israel?"

context: In mid May 1967, the <a0_0>Soviet Union i<a0_0/>ssued warnings to Nasser of an impending Israeli attack on Syria. Although the chief of staff <a1_0>Mohamed Fawzi<a1_0/> verified them as "baseless", Nasser took <a2_0>three successive steps<a2_0/> that made the war virtually inevitable: On 14 May he deployed his troops in Sinai near the border with Israel, on 19 May he expelled the UN peacekeepers stationed in the Sinai Peninsula border with Israel, and on <a3_0>23 May<a3_0/> he closed the Straits of Tiran to Israeli shipping. On 26 May Nasser declared, "The battle will be a general one and our basic objective will be to destroy Israel".
